perturbation.original_text:
Agreement to Supply.
(a)
Affiliates and Facility Addenda. Either the entity designated above as Customer or any Affiliate of Customer and either the entity
designated above as Manufacturer or any Affiliate of Manufacturer may enter into Facility Addenda under this Agreement. The
entities that execute a Facility Addendum are also deemed to be “Customer” and “Manufacturer” (respectively) for all purposes of the
Facility Addendum and this Agreement (with respect to the applicable Facility Addendum).
perturbation.changed_text:
Agreement to Supply.
(a)
Affiliates and Facility Addenda. Either the entity designated above as Customer or any Affiliate of Customer and either the entity
designated above as Manufacturer or any Affiliate of Manufacturer may enter into Facility Addenda under this Agreement. The
entities that execute a Facility Addendum are also deemed to be “Client” and “Vendor” (respectively) for all purposes of the
Facility Addendum and this Agreement (with respect to the applicable Facility Addendum).
perturbation.explanation: The terms “Customer” and “Manufacturer” are replaced with “Client” and “Vendor”. The contract later uses Customer and Manufacturer and does not state that they are interchangeable, causing confusion on obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
(a)
Mutual Covenants. Each Party hereby covenants to the other Party that it will perform its activities under this Agreement in full compliance
with all applicable Global Trade Control Laws, including as follows:
(b)
prior to engaging in any activities in a Restricted Market, involving individuals ordinarily resident in a Restricted Market or including
companies, organizations, or Governmental Authorities from or located in a Restricted Market in each case in connection with this
Agreement, each Party must first notify the other Party (which notice, notwithstanding Section 17, shall be addressed to (a) Pluto at
gtc@pfizer.com and (b) Spinco at [●]), who will review and, if compliant with Global Trade Control Laws, approve (subject to any
appropriate conditions) such activities (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed), within five (5) Business Days of
such notification;
perturbation.changed_text:
(a)
Mutual Covenants. Each Party hereby covenants to the other Party that it will perform its activities under this Agreement in full compliance
with all applicable Global Trade Control Laws, including as follows:
(b)
prior to engaging in any activities in a Restricted Market, involving individuals ordinarily resident in a Restricted Market or including
companies, organizations, or Governmental Agencies from or located in a Restricted Market in each case in connection with this
Agreement, each Party must first notify the other Party (which notice, notwithstanding Section 17, shall be addressed to (a) Pluto at
gtc@pfizer.com and (b) Spinco at [●]), who will review and, if compliant with Global Trade Control Laws, approve (subject to any
appropriate conditions) such activities (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed), within five (5) Business Days of
such notification;
perturbation.explanation: “Governmental Authorities” is replaced with “Governmental Agencies.” The contract fails to define whether “Governmental Authorities” and “Governmental Agencies” are the same, and since both terms appear multiple times, it creates uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
In the event of the termination or expiration of this Agreement for any other reason, Customer shall have no obligation to
purchase any Product Materials. Any Product Materials that are not purchased or required to be purchased by Customer pursuant to this
Section 7.9 shall be disposed of or destroyed in accordance with Customer’s instructions, which costs shall be borne by Manufacturer.
perturbation.changed_text:
In the event of the termination or expiration of this Agreement for any other reason, Customer shall have no obligation to
purchase any Product Components. Any Product Materials that are not purchased or required to be purchased by Customer pursuant to this
Section 7.9 shall be disposed of or destroyed in accordance with Customer’s instructions, which costs shall be borne by Manufacturer.
perturbation.explanation: “Product Materials” is replaced with “Product Components.” The contract fails to define whether “Product Components” and “Product Materials” are the same, and since both terms appear multiple times and have individual definitions it creates uncertainty.
